_header: Ever sovereign sweet sweetest in sight
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 389; cf. 1220.
_description: Humfrey Newton, a love letter to his best beloved mistress, with acrostic on Elin — one quatrain

BodLatMisC66.Transcription:
Euer souereyn swete swettist in siȝtlose me of my care as ye are
                    creatour kithin wo I ly for your beaut so briȝtno thinge may me
                    glade noþer meyte ne mirthe
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 267.
